snippet: South Africa’s main opposition group on Sunday chose its first black leader at a party congress, in a country whose governing party has dominated since 1994.
abstract: South Africa's liberal opposition Democratic Alliance party elects Mmusi Maimane as its first black leader in effort to broaden party's appeal; South Africa has been dominated by governing party since country's first all-race elections in 1994.
lead_paragraph: South Africa’s main opposition group on Sunday chose its first black leader at a party congress, in a country whose governing party has dominated since 1994.

headline.main: South Africa: Opposition Chooses First Black Leader
headline.print_headline: South Africa: Opposition Chooses First Black Leader
